file_content.text: It's like blasting wraids in a box canyon!
I was starting to think you got lost! I guess you're buying the drinks when this is done.
Last one to the shield generator buys all the drinks!
This will do nicely! I think we're finally ready. Let's hit that shield generator right between the eyes.
Staying cool out there?
Heard you took out heavy resistance at the shield generator. That got Zakuul's forces stirred-up--and not only them.
Scout that shield generator's bunker and see what we're up against. I'll have news when you get back.
Welcome back to Tatooine, Commander. The locals still talk about your last visit. You left quite an impression. The name's Leyta, but everyone calls me "Deadeye." I'm your contact here.
I'm not looking for trouble. That doesn't mean it won't find me.
You smell that? Burning detonite. There's nothing else like it. Reminds me of home.
Theron made me a holorecording of the Star Fortress going up in flames over Tatooine.
I almost feel bad for the locals. It blew up on the nighttime side of the planet. Folks must have thought morning came early.
There's nothing I hate more than a bully. We did a good thing, Commander. And it looks like I'll be sticking around.
You need a good blaster at your side, you know who to call. See you around.
Any gang on Tatooine with a starship is ready to punch you an opening inside that Star Fortress.
The sooner we take that thing down, the better. I heard what happened to Bothawui.
Tatooine isn't much to look at, but there are good people living on it right next to the bad ones.
And if you need any other motivation, I might just be persuaded to stick around as your hired gun once this is all over.
The Star Fortress shield is down. Time to finish the job and knock that hunk of junk out of the sky forever.
Theron Shan wants me to help coordinate the strike from Odessen. Looks like you're stuck with me a little while longer, Commander.
You'll always have a place on my team if you want one.
Thanks! I haven't had a real job in... well, I've never had a real job. Could be interesting.
What do you know about organizing raids on battle stations?
It's still a shootout. The fundamentals don't change. It's all about positioning and aim. The blasters are bigger, that's all.
And our allies on Tatooine? What about them?
They think you're aces, and they plan to keep fighting. Don't worry, I'll keep them together for the Alliance.
My transport is waiting. See you on Odessen.
This bunker's got a weak spot. We plant explosives there, and this place will go down like a drunken bantha.
You lead the way. I'll cover your back.
I'll get this last batch of gear to our friends and meet you inside the shield generator. See you there!
[Turn in Smuggled Goods crate.]
Nice haul, Commander. I don't know what half this stuff is, but it'll come in handy.
[Report the Tatooine Resistance Campaign is complete to receive a massive Influence gain.]
Nice work!
We're off to a great start. With a few more supplies, we should be all set.
I'll be back.
I'll be here.
[Start the Tatooine Resistance Campaign. Completion will grant a massive Influence gain.]
You may want to check in with your old friends and see what sort of help they need. They can express their gratitude with some shiny new gear.
[Start a Heroic Mission to secure supply crates.]
There's nothing that greases palms faster than desperation. I know something you could do that'll net us lots of gear.
[Start an Eternal Empire Champion Duel.]
I think Zakuul knows you're down here. They sent some big guns to hunt you down.
I've always subscribed to the idea of shooting first. There's no telling what kind of gear you could loot off Zakuul's finest.
I'm getting the supplies to our allies. When you have more to distribute, come find me.
Your message was heard all over this dustball. Every gang in hiding discovered it still had a backbone.
I think we've got enough foot soldiers to mount a full-scale insurgency. The trick now is getting them military-grade gear.
Let me guess... you need me to provide that gear?
They said you were a genius. I never doubted it.
The criminal syndicates should have more than enough firepower of their own.
They have blasters, sure. But desert warfare is a whole other thing. These thugs are used to living in cantinas.
The Republic and the Sith Empire never completely gave up this world. You can still find their outposts.
I'm thinking the Alliance can build some goodwill and secure the supplies we need to hit that shield generator where it hurts.
I'll do some digging and see what turns up, but it'll go faster if you help. You know where to find me.
That's an interesting nickname. How did you get it?
The hard way. I killed a whole lot of people who disagreed with me. Started on my home world, Corellia.
One of the bigger tribes kept coming after mine. Stealing our food, treating us like slaves. I went to have a chat with them.
We started out just trading words, but in the end it was all blasters. When the smoke cleared, I was the last one standing.
That explains why they call you "Deadeye." You must be amazing with that blaster.
I'm not some trick-shot artist, if that's what you're thinking. I aim where it counts, that's all.
You killed the entire tribe? No one survived?
Some ran when the blasting started. I guess they're alive. The rest got what was coming to them.
Impressive. I assume that slaughter was only the beginning of your reputation.
I don't know why people keep picking fights with me. I must have the kind of face they want to punch in.
My family decided it was best if I left Corellia for a while. I've been kicking around the Outer Rim ever since.
But those Eternal Empire scum keep bothering me. I finally had enough and signed on with your Alliance.
Enough about me. Let's talk about that Star Fortress and why it's orbiting Tatooine.
I can't say Tatooine impressed me. I don't even remember being here.
Consider yourself lucky. Most people spend their whole lives trying to forget this planet.
I never thought I'd have to revisit this backwater planet.
That's the thing about Tatooine. Every time you think you've seen it for the last time, there it is again.
We were all surprised when that Star Fortress showed up in orbit. We couldn't figure what Zakuul wanted with Tatooine.
Why does the Eternal Empire care about Tatooine enough to put a Star Fortress over it?
That's the first thing the rest of us wondered when it popped into orbit. You'd think Zakuul had bigger wraids to roast.
Near as we can tell, Zakuul thinks this world is some kind of criminal haven. They send forces down here to "clean things up."
Two of the bigger syndicates vanished overnight. Zakuul killed everybody. The other gangs went into hiding. It's hard to know how many are left.
I don't approve of Zakuul's methods, but I suspect life has improved for the honest citizens.
Are you kidding? The ranchers and moisture farmers are scared to death. They figure they're all next on the list.
Hunting random thugs seems like a waste of time for Zakuul's forces.
I got a theory that Tatooine is a testing ground. They may plan to do this on other planets they consider "high crime." Corellia, for instance.
Nobody kills these scum except me. I was here first.
Don't expect me to shed any tears for criminals.
Fair enough, but I'm looking at the bigger picture--and I don't like what I see.
People should be free to misbehave. Zakuul's idea of law and order is killing everybody it doesn't like. And yes, I'm aware of the irony, so move on....
My orders are to help you turn that Star Fortress into Tatooine's third sun. But we won't get far until we take out its shield.
There's a bunker nearby housing the shield generator. We've got to find a way inside.
You should go take a look, but fair warning--there's probably something nasty patrolling the perimeter.
I've been calling in some favors. I should have some good news when you get back.
[Report the Tatooine Resistance Campaign is complete to receive a massive Influence gain.]
[Start the Tatooine Resistance Campaign. Completion will grant a massive Influence gain.]
[Do Nothing.]
You need a good blaster at your side, you know who to call. See you around.
[Turn in Alien Research crate.]
[Turn in Ancient Artifact crate.]
[Turn in Military Equipment crate.]
[Turn in supply crates.]
I actually miss the smell of Bantha. Is that odd?
It turns out that shipping in womp rats for target practice isn't considered a "priority."
My toes get cold here. I haven't experienced that since Corellia.
Some of the crew needs to work on their blaster grip. It looks like I'll have to share some tricks with the five-fingers.
So many faces, but you collaborate as well as the tribes back home. Zakuul is clearly underestimating their competition.
[Go Back.]
Let's go find some excitement, Commander.
The next idiot who waves his hand in my face looking for my "Deadeye" gets to eat my blaster.
Keep your eyes on the action, Commander, and you'll never miss.
